Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: qtpi1
Reviews.Content: This is a very old building with some beautiful architecture in an ideal spot. Everything you need is within a 5-10 minute walk or a 5 minute walk to the transportation to get you there. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and our room was very clean. The room itself (ours was a hotel room) was extremely small. There was just enough room on either side of the bed to walk. One straight chair was provided and this needed to be moved to get into the dresser. We were also on an inside room which meant that our room looked out into a dark abyss surrounded by other walls. When it rained the rain beat on the metal rails which was less than soothing. Of course this cannot be changed by the hotel - just try to request an outside room. We spent 3 nights and were really there only to sleep so this was adequate. Breakfast - cereal, toast, apples, pastry (not worth the calories) and an occasional bagel, coffee and juice - not the greatest for sure. With all that said - I would recommend this location - especially if you get a one bedroom suite as that would have made it a much more comfortable stay. The location cannot be beat for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Especially good for city walkers!”
Reviews.Author: idbill1
Reviews.Content: For people interested in more than Sea World who like to explore on foot, this hotel is centrally located and offers great value. It is situated at the start of the bars, restaurants, and entertainment on gentrified 5th Ave., a stone’s throw from the Westfield Horton Shopping Plaza where tour buses stop. Walking a bit further brings you to the convention center and touristy waterfront. Taxis to must-visit Balboa Park are around $10. We were able to book a very large top floor suite for a weekday rate of less than $200 per night. The small staff who rotate through the front desk were friendly and in our case exceptionally helpful. The hotel’s self-serve breakfast is modest but provided on the roof top (part of which is under cover) where the view more than compensates. We found this historic property to be clean and well maintained… very easy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Angebange
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. The room was lovely, it had a separate sitting room to watch TV which I loved. Kind of decorated in an old fashioned way. It was a bargain at less than $110 a night, in a fantastic location right in the middle of the action of the gaslamp area. The breakfast on the roof is great, and even better that it is included in the already cheap price. There is also a book swap up on the roof, which is a great way to get something new to read on your holiday. Paying for internet is expensive, but fair enough as it is a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: CotoPeki
Reviews.Content: I went here with my boyfriend a little while ago while he was going to the ASM meeting. It is a reasonable walk from the Convention Center. It's in a nice part of San Diego, not scary at all at night. There were a lot of cool bars and restaurants around to go to at night. The trolly was close, which took you to different parts of the city, and you can buy passes to ride it. The front desk was SUPER helpful giving tips and directions about where to go while in San Diego! The hotel was average. Not super luxurious, but nice. It was clean and the maids did a great job cleaning. The rooms are actually about 2x as big as a normal hotel. They come with a huge sitting area to watch tv, which is nice. In the morning, they have a little continental breakfast up on the rooftop. There were bagels, muffins, cereal, fruit, juice. It has an AMAZING view of the city. It's a cool place to take pictures. Also a great place to relax and read during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Suites-Go back in History”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to get away for a couple days for President's weekend before things got real busy. We stayed, for the first time, at Gaslamp Plaza Suites. Without any prior knowledge of this hotel and relying on reviews of others, I booked it. We love being in the center of Gaslamp when we stay in San Diego especially when we catch a Padres game and eat at the incrediable restaurants. This hotel has alot of history being the first skyscraper in San Diego. http://www.gaslampplaza.com/history.html The original materials have been preserved and rooms were clean and updated while retaining its history. We stayed on the 4th floor in the Emerson room. Our Queen bed was comfortable. Our teenage son used the pullout couch, which was not comfortable at all so he slept on the couch it self without the pullout bed. In the morning starting at 7 am they have coffee and a continental breakfast. The coffee was good but the breakfast was run of the mill, carb filled toast, pastries, and cereal. If you want a great breakfast, go to Brians 24 http://www.yelp.com/biz/brians-24-san-diego around the corner next to the lobby of the Ramada. The service at the hotel was excellent! It is valet parking and runs $28 a day but that is reasonable in San Diego and has in and out priviledges. When we needed our car, we phoned down 15 minutes before and it was there when we arrived! The parking attendants were polite abd responsible. A couple of small negatives- the noise on Saturday night was somewhat loud till 2 am but that is to be expected in the city (windows were all updated and kept noise to a minimum) Sunday night was much better, no mirror in the living area-just the bathroom, and the breakfast needs improving. All in all we liked this hotel and our stay in San Diego and will consider this hotel again. It felt like we were back in the 1940's with updated facilites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BarbSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites in February for a three night stay and were very impressed. It is exactly as seen on their website. We had a one bedroom suite which was perfect. The room sizes were much bigger than expected. We loved the terrace, the views were fabulous and we managed to sit there each morning for breakfast. The continental breakfast was very good and it was complimentary. The decor throughout the hotel was very good, in keeping with the historic building. The staff on the reception were pleasant except on one ocassion when we asked if it was possible to have some milk for our coffee she said we could go and buy some! Not what we really wanted to hear but in the end she had some delivered to our room. Our room was cleaned and towels changed each day during our stay. The location was excellent as their are lots of shops, bars and restaurants in the Gaslamp district. This was our first visit to San Diego and we loved it and staying in the Gaslamp Suites was certainly the best choice we made. We would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Historic! What a secret gem!”
Reviews.Author: jaimielaura
Reviews.Content: We had such a lovely experience at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites. From the staff to the location and the beautiful room, it could not have been better! We got into town early and prior to check in. Sean at the front desk was so helpful and accommodating. He stored our luggage, provided directions from the airport via the public bus. The hotel was inexpensive, but absolutely luxurious. We have a suite with a separate bedroom. It had two beautiful bathrooms, lovely new carpet, drapes and furniture. What a special hotel in a special town. The room was quiet, there was great natural light, it was spacious, and so centrally located. I really encourage you to try this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “AUH-SOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jerkfacedeersandwich
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in! The hallways were so pretty with marble floors and glass doors, we felt so classy staying there. Pros: -in the HEART of the gaslamp! Every night spot we wanted to go to was in walking distance -bed was super comfortable -staff were amazingly friendly -dvd kiosk to rent movies -beautiful rooftop terrace to enjoy (the free) breakfast -room key gives lets you cut in line at their lounge, Vin de Syrah Cons -sofa bed was somewhat uncomfortable -valet parking was stinkin 28 bucks a day! -its prime location means it can be hard to sleep from noisy the party animals down below if your room is facing 5th st ..so just wake up and go party too, problem solved

Reviews.Title: “ddb”
Reviews.Author: Dan B
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the middle of San Diego's Gaslamp district. Close to light rail. Suite was reasonably priced and very big. Great view from the breakfast area on the roof but a less than mediocre breakfast. Still worth sitting up there and looking out, though.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Shirley M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our timeshare and had no idea what if might be like except for the beautiful room pictures on their web site. We were delighted with the activity in the area, we were able to walk to at least 50 restaurants, bars etc in just a few minutes. We really enjoyed the openair rooftop restaurant which offered a wonderful continental breakfast each morning.There is no better way to start the day by relaxing and looking out at the ships sailing by in the harbor. We found people were up there at all times of the day, reading, tanning or just sitting under an umbrella. Our room was truly as it might have been decorated when the hotel opened around 1908.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Lynher
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 days based on favourable Tripadvisor reviews. The reception staff especially Mary and Jennifer were very helpful with their leaflets, tips,directions and suggestions to help us with transport, sightseeing, eating out etc. We were given a comfortable suite on the 8th floor as requested. It came with a small kitchenette complete with a microwave and coffee maker. Breakfast which was just adequate was on the roof top with panoramic views of the city.The location was ideal being in the centre of down-town San Diego. There was a big choice of restaurants nearby offering different cuisines. We savoured different one every day. San Diego has good and cheap public transport offering discounted tickets for multiple journeys. If one likes to gawk at sad,bored,miserable caged animals then San Diego Zoo is a must. I am against this but was forced to accompany my wife who has no such sentiments wanting to see some of the rarer animals namely the polar bears, pandas and orang-utans. For the same reason Seaworld was not on the agenda ,instead watched grey whales migration from Point Loma and went on a disappointing whale watching boat trip, as the whales were shy and reclusive! The neighbourhood was noisy at night with revellers having a good time. Homeless people populated the corners of cross-roads with the inevitable supermarket trolley, black bin liners, rummaging about in the rubbish bins for left over scraps of food. We never felt threatened by them, in fact some were good musicians and some had a lively sense of humour. San Diego is a fabulous place for a holiday with great choice of hotels, varied cuisine,spectacular coastline,scenery, not to mention lots to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Roof Top Garden”
Reviews.Author: marybvg
Reviews.Content: A beautiful roof top garden and reasonable room rates make this a wonderful alternative to the typical chain hotels in San Diego. The roof top was the location for a free continental breakfast and a place to hang out all day long on lounge chairs or at tables. A great place to watch the sun set over the bay. Guests can bring in their own food and beverage as there is no restaurant on the roof. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The decor is nothing special but the rooms/suites are large and very clean. Since the hotel is located in the Gaslamp Quarter, it is somewhat noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: travelBerlin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for four nights previous to our cruise. Our room was very nice and had a small kitchenette. Breakfast was simple, but enough to start the day. The hotel had good flyiers with information on activities and restaurants in the neighborhood. I love crabs and there was a very good restaurant which served crabs cajun style. They were really good. Shopping was at walking distance. Also at walking distance was a stop of a tour bus. We found the location ideal, the hotel was a good choice, San Diego a lovely city with good food. We will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: AlohaJunky
Reviews.Content: We went here with my sister and her son. We had 2 rooms booked. One was a suite the other was a standard room. Definitely get the suite. The standard rooms are the size of a shoebox. The hotel was built approximately 75 years ago as an office building which was then converted to a hotel in the eighties. Overall the rooms are decent and clean but you are staying in a historic building so it is certainly not modern. The major advantage of this hotel is location. You are only a few minutes from many major attractions and it is situated in a trendy neighborhood with plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. If you plan to rent a car be aware that the hotel charges about $30/day to park there (valet service mandatory) and there is no free parking nearby. No swimming pool if you have kids. Continental breakfast is very average.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, value, location, a great way to end our tour”
Reviews.Author: elephantschild
Reviews.Content: After 2 weeks in motels, this was the height of luxury ! a 'mini-suite' (a large L shaped room with a sitting area and a mini-kitchen, beautifully furnished, and with a nice town view, for 109$ a night (including tax, excluding parking). The breakfast terrace on the roof, which allows smoking in the open part, was a wonderful bonus, great views over the whole of downtown while enjoying a breakfast in the sun or in the shade, your choice. The location in the Gaslamp area is great, the 19th century look and feel, the shopping, and nightlife is all here, no need to get the tourist-shafting experience in the Old Town (although the Old Town is a wonderful place to explore by day, by night it is disappointing). The Gaslamp Plaza is within 20 minutes walk, for a good walker, of the Embarcadero, the Maritime Museum, the USS Midway, and within a few blocks drive of Balboa Park. Only slight caveat, the 28$ valet parking. There is an excellent drive-in car park for 10â‚¬ a night or 1â‚¬ an hour during the day, 2 blocks down on the corner of 6th & Market. And my wife didn't let me forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: jrt3046
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Gaslamp Plaza. Greeted by a enthusiastic front desk girl named Merry. She was a lot of fun and handled our check in swiftly. Rooms are nice and large. We had a one bedroom suite. Room had two tv's and a mini fridge and microwave as well as plates and silverware. Parking is 28 a day but the valet service was excellent. The ONLY drawback is that at night when you are ready to hit the sack, the noise from all the people that are partying can be overwhelming since the hotel is located right in the middle of all the clubs. But you can get free ear plugs at the front desk. Or better yet just go party with the rest of them and then hit the sack!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! But even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: trico711
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here and we will definitely stay here again. The location is right in the gaslamp walking distance from all the pubs and restaurants and clubs. The room was clean and not all dumpy like some of the surounding hotels. The staff was awsome! When we checked I had mentioned that ot was my wifes birthday so she sang her happy birthday (great voice too) and gave us a free desert at the Melting pot next door, the valet driver was probably the most kindest valet driver I have ever came across, usually they are rude and I kind of regret giving them the keys to my car. We checked out and after after getting home I realized I forgot to grab my phone I left in the room so I called and Holly was so nice and kind enough to call me back and mail me my phone the very next day. Thanks Holly! Thanks Gaslamp plaza suites! hope to come back in Feb.!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel Delightful”
Reviews.Author: shooter0913
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, very clean and updated with a great view on the roof of Fifth Avenue all the way out to the Bay. The manager was extremely helpful in getting us into the room earlier than check in time, and accommodated us by holding our baggage so we could walk around and start seeing the city. One of the most reasonable priced hotels in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Hjk131
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for numerous attractions. It's a quick walk to Petco Field, the Bay, and numerous restaurants and bars. The staff was friendly and the rooms were nice. I have noticed people complaining about the street noise. We only stayed here one night (Friday night) and were not kept awake by any street noise. The views from the rooftop were amazing. We loved San Diego, and would stay here again upon visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Old Beauty”
Reviews.Author: shorthuntsville
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised at how unusual and special the rooms are in this hotel. Our room was huge. The rooms on our floor all had names, the wood work was very beautiful and the tile and windows art deco. Our room also had a huge couch in it, great to curl up and read a book or watch TV. Breakfast on the roof garden was really nice and had a spectacular view of the city. The front desk staff were very helpfull and one of the front desk ladies even gave us a mini history lesson. The only issue we had was that because it was in the center of things, it tended to be a little noisy at night, but being in the center of things also made it easy to find restaurants, bars and stores.

Reviews.Title: “So much Fun in Gaslamp!”
Reviews.Author: kkirwan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for overnight for our anniversary and Memorial Day weekend get-away. Not too many hotels directly IN the Gaslamp Quarter, so I was excited to find this nice, historical one right there. We arrived Sat morning and it was a little tricky finding parking, so we just paid extra to park in hotel lot, which was valet also. Room was pretty old but VERY classy and well laid out, with a fridge, microwave, nice loveseat and coffee table. The bathroom was nice but laid out a little funny ~ the electrical outlets didn't match up near the vanity area and there was a lack of them too. Nice view of the street below and the hotel is smack in the middle of Gaslamp ~ walking distance to pretty much everywhere we wanted to go. Super close to Horton Plaza with tons of cute shops and restaurants all around. We had a King bed that was very comfortable and placed next to window so we could enjoy the view (big full length window!). The best part about this hotel was by far the very cool rooftop terrace. The view was amazing! Nice chairs and loungers available, not crowded at all. Husband got the free breakfast the next morning and he said it was pretty average but had great juice. The elevators in this hotel are original and beautiful (and not slow either!). Hallways on some floors were the original marble also ~ so pretty! It used to be a bank many years ago. We popped into the little bar in the basement (don't remember name) and it looked really nice ~ cozy and romantic. We spent the evening wandering around Gaslamp during Happy Hour where it seemed like everyone had some great HH deals. Unfortunatley, had a few too many of those "drink specials", and had to be walked back to very nice hotel room way too early! So watch out for those HH "specials"!! Staff was VERY nice ~ the elevator man gave my husband a little history lesson about hotel and the vintage elevators (first in SD, I think). A very nice hotel but a bit pricey ~ we are dying to go back (as I feel I need a "do-over"!) and will definately stay at Gaslamp Plaza Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: Birdboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 day for a conference at the Westin in Horton Plaza. It was an easy 5 minute walk to everything downtown,the mall, dining, transportation. I'm a heavy sleeper, so the noise level from the bars downstairs did not bother me. Would definately stay here again. Staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in accomidations”
Reviews.Author: Rider_K
Reviews.Content: After surfing web, finding the location & getting a great price, I looked forward to staying in the Gaslamp Quarter of the 619. It was easy to get to from the Trolley stop 2 blocks north. It was later that I found out that I was a block away from Horton Plaza, a major shopping center. The accomadations of a small suite were excellent. My suite was located in the corner, past two doors. It was fully stocked with the ammenites. The queen size bed was comfortable. I forgot about the breakfast in the morning but there are a lot of great restaurants within walking distance (The Beer Co., SmashBurger, etc.) Public Transportation was also nearby (Trolley, Metro Bus, Amtrak) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it we will be back, :-)”
Reviews.Author: JUdyrem
Reviews.Content: I did not think this hotel was any noisier than the Sheraton Downtown LA. The room was SO very nicely appointed, and I have been in many differant hotels. The rooftop terrace was AMAZING. We had some wine and cheese and I was in LOVE. I adore old historic buildings, and this was a gem! Don't listen to the naysayers, this a good hotel in a good location with wonderful rooms. It is probably not for people with small children. If you are so blessed, you should stay near Sea World

Reviews.Title: “Neat Old & Nostalgic”
Reviews.Author: MrSL0TS
Reviews.Content: We actually booked this using the Hotel Tonight App and with my credits saved $40. Hotel located downtown with many restaurants and a mall within walking distance. Suites have fridge,micro,hair dryer,safe,iron....these old suites sure beat the typical hotel room. If you have an iPhone or Android, be sure to download app Hotel Tonight for discounts.Use this invite code (dstanert) for instant $25 credit. It will be added to your account.Then add this additional promo code (GETHT) for another $15 in credit. Which can be used at any Hotel Tonight hotels!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NOISEY”
Reviews.Author: onthego4850
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and the hotel had charm, but the noise level was horrible. You could hear everything and everybody going up and down the street. This went on till 2am ! There was a man on the corner of E & 5th that played amplified music until 2 the first night. We had to call the city the next night to stop him at 12:30. The hotel needs to redo the windows to double pane to quite the noise level. Would I stay again, probably NOT. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: paxton7
Reviews.Content: this is the hotel to book when in san diego, great situ, comfortable rooms and breakfast on the roof if weather allows. loads of bars right on door step even nightclub in basement. staff very helpfull conferance centre 5 mins walk, aircraft carrier midway 20mins walk. if you have a car the parking can be expensive but thats the only downside

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel, fantastic front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: suzaru07
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family with 2 boys for 3 nights in July 2011. This is an old bank that has been beautifully restored to maintain it's charm. The Gaslamp Quarter is right at it's doorstep so we had restaurants and shopping within easy walking distance. Safe area. The front desk staff were extremely helpful especially Merry who made us feel like one of her family!! Exceptionally warm and knowledgeable. She gave us great advice and suggestions. We would definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “OK - Needs work”
Reviews.Author: TandCindyBear
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a one bedroom suite at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites during the last week of June. While the hotel is still charming, and in a great location, it is starting to show its age. The electrical outlets in the room were all loose and made the lights flicker. It seemed very unsafe. Carpets were worn and needed cleaning. Although there were two flat screen TVs - the other furnishings were very worn and old. The TV in the bedroom was very small and far away from the bed. Our particular room had two windows - one had a bullet hole, and both windows were faced with chicken wire. When you opened the windows, if you could, they were loud and made a lot of noise. The units are dark and narrow. There is a minifridge and a microwave. There are dishes, but no counterspace. Wireless internet is available for $20 per week. Parking is still valet and cost $28 per night, but call Central Parking - you can get a great deal and pay the monthly rate for a nearby lot and spend a fraction of what you would at the hotel. There is no pool or workout facitlity, but you can get a pass from the front desk to go to a nearby health club. It will cost $7.50 per day per person. The maids came through each day with fresh towels and to remove trash. There is nowhere for you to throw away your own trash, so if you need it out sooner than the next cleaning, you have to call the front desk. Continental breakfast is on the rooftop every day. It is a nice way to start your day. The food is exactly the same every day, so if you are not ready for cheerios, raisin bran, or plain oatmeal, bring along something for yourself. There is coffee, juice, bread, apples and oranges. A microwave is available. The only change in menu was additional bagels two days a week. The hotel is in a great location, in walking distance to everything - Horton Plaza, restaurants, bars, Seaport Village, the Embarcadero. But, being in the middle of downtown also means lots of sirens, homeless people at every turn and plenty of crowds. There was quite a bit of noise in our room from the street and we were on the 6th floor. All of the staff was helpful and friendly. They did whatever they could to help us have a fun vacation. Definitely go to the orientation on the first day. Merry will have a lot of little tips for you and suggestions for places to go. We have stayed in a wide range of hotels and resorts, and we would still have to give the Plaza Suites a 5 out of 10. The place still has a lot of character and a good location, but is very lacking in amentities.

Reviews.Title: “Not a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: zsesame
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week. The people were nice, but the room wasn't clean enough. There was candy left on the floor when we arrived. The room itself didn't have any windows! The bedroom had two windows that looked at the wall of the next building. The nicest feature of the hotel was the roof which had chairs and a lovely view. We wouldn't choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, given false info”
Reviews.Author: lee172
Reviews.Content: made reservation several months in advance, was told over phone and at desk could check in at 2:30, left our bags and came back at 2:30, was told rooms were not cleaned and check in time was 4o'clock, lady at desk was rude, and was more concerned in showing us She was in charge! also check out time was 11:00 O'clock next day! Have stayed here b4 this was worst experience, plus the place is starting to look dated. will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mamey2422
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza twice and thoroughly enjoyed my experience both times. The hotel is clean, the staff extremely friendly and helpful and the cost was reasonable. I stayed in the single bed studio for one trip when I was traveling alone and in a suite when I traveled with a guest and both rooms were spacious, comfortable, clean, and offered just what I needed for the occasion. The single bed studio was a snug fit but still very comfortable, larger than I expected and the room included a desk, closet, microwave, fridge. In the heart of downtown, and walking distance to shopping, restaurants, Little Italy and more, the Gaslamp Plaza is in a wonderful, central location. The hotel rooftop which is open until 11: 00 pm is a unique feature and a great place to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast, read, relax or simply take in the view. Internet costs $10/day which was reasonable. Valet parking was $28/day, while somewhat pricey, was very convenient and I was able to come and go as I pleased without worrying about street parking. The hotel was offering a discount both times that I stayed there, which made the cost reasonable for me. Without the discount it would not have been in my personal budget but I would definitely consider the hotel worth the full price cost. The noise level is what you would expect from a hotel located in a downtown area - i.e. typical traffic noise but not unordinarily loud. The only thing I felt was missing was on an premise workout room. There are gyms within walking distance that they recommend and there's plenty of walking to do visiting San Diego but nothing is available within the hotel. I would definitely recommend the Gaslamp Plaza Suites to anyone visiting San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and History, Great Location in Lively Area”
Reviews.Author: davestan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a 1 bedroom corner suite. Nice views of the city. Great location in the Gaslamp district with restaurants and nightlife on your doorstep. Opposite the large Horton Plaza shopping centre which also houses a movie complex. Breakfast was minimal and basic. The rooftop terrace area was very nice with great city views. The Suite we had was overall spacious and comfortable, furnished in keeping with the historic style of the building . Old tube TV in sitting room(needs updating) and small flat screen in bedroom. No free Wifi in room and we thought parking was rather expensive at $28 per day. The hotel overall has a nice historic ambience, with many impressive architectural marble features. The staff we had contact with were very friendly and helpful which we appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DiabloDeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites for an extended weekend trip in Room 1008. The valet and front desk were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is like stepping back in time with the marble floors and stairs, brass accents and crystal chandelier. We had a top floor room which appeared to have been two hotel rooms they made into one to be a one bedroom suite. The view was nice looking out to the west and had a microwave and mini fridge in the room complete with a set of dishes. There is a free continental breakfast that is served on the roof top every morning. There is much to see and do in the Gaslamp Quarter, there are many restaurants nearby that offer just about any type of food you would be craving. Lots of stores, theaters, etc. Even though there are lots of homeless people on the streets we were never bothered by any of them. There is a Melting Pot restaurant inside the hotel that I highly recommend as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Noisy Place”
Reviews.Author: 1DW1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on a Thursday and Friday night. Overall, the quality was exceptional. We had a suite on the tenth floor which looked out toward the bay. The suite was well kept and the bathroom facilities were modernized. The two elevators were quaint and it was a bit startlng walking to our room because all the hallway doors were old glass panel doors with mail slots. This place must have been an office building at one point. The hotel service personnel were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Of course, parking is ugly. $28 a night. For the two days we stayed we either walked or took public transportation which was quite easy to do. For info on things to do in San Diego, there were several magazines inside the desk drawer which were very helpful. Many had discount coupons in them. This is a non-smoking hotel but people were smoking in the Garden-top roof area. The continental breakfast up there was passable - nothing really spectacular. As for the noise, it is definitely there. From about 9pm to 2 or 3 in the morning there was chatter, shouting, music, a guy with a megaphone saying something about God, sirens and more sirens. And we were ten floors up. On Friday night, my wife and I watched out the window for nearly two hours until finally at about 1 am, we threw on some clothes and went out and mingled for awhile - rowdy students, homeless people and hookers. It was quite entertaining. At about 8 am in the morning, all the streets were cleaned up, immaculate even, and the whole neighborhood was dead quiet. An amazing transformation. If you require a place that is clean, well appointed and quiet, the Gaslamp Plaza Suites can only qualify in two of those three categories. I cannot fault them for being located in a chaotic area. My wife and I look forward to booking with them again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I ever had!”
Reviews.Author: alexandraberlin_11
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in May 2010 for about a month and I have to say its really the best!! I am handicapped and need some help every day and the staff over there was the friendliest I ever experienced! In the end of my holiday I really felt I had found a new family in them! My special thanks go to Sean, Merry, Carlos, Martha and Holly! Love you all!

Reviews.Title: “so noisy!”
Reviews.Author: desertfor123456
Reviews.Content: [stayed 1 night late 2008] great location & ambiance, cool little room, not expensive, but could not sleep at night due to street noise so reluctantly changed hotel next day

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Logan25
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Gaslamp. Our previous stay was about 5 years ago. The hotel hasn't changed much. Both times we had a mini suite with queen bed. I would highly recommend booking this room. It is nice to have a separate seating area from the bedroom. We did however notice the noise from the street this time. We were there over a weekend and on the Saturday it was well after 2:00 a.m. before the street quietened down. Not the hotel's fault but something to keep in mind. Also we booked this time through Tavelocity and I'm not sure if that was why our check-in did not go smoothly or not. We arrived early so were not surprised that the room was not ready. They gladly took our bags and said to come back in an hour, which would have been 1:30, and the room would be ready. We went over to Horton Plaza and then lunch at the Hard Rock and got back to the hotel about 1 1/2 hours later. It was a different front desk clerk. He told us the room was booked through "some website" and that it was not ready to come back at 3:00. We went to the rooftop and came back at 2:55. He said it was still not ready so we sat in the lobby. He looked at the clock at 3:02, with no call to or from housekeeping, and said it's ready. Really? There were couples in front of us who got their rooms and were thanked for booking through their website. All in all, it did not ruin our stay and we would consider staying there again but not on a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “great location....BUT..”
Reviews.Author: jackal58
Reviews.Content: The location is about the best thing about this place, except for a few friendly staff. The rooms are pokey, unless you pay top dollar. The first room we were shown wasn't even large enough to put two suitcases on the floor. I thought our room was meant to have a lounge, so mentioned this, then was put into a "larger" room of the same value? This room was only a little wider than the bed (with a lounge) and has a curtain behind the bed, pretending to cover the window....that doesnt exist. By the end of our stay we both had some sort of cold or sore throat from breathing the dank recycled air. The included continental brekky was very basic carb-loaded rubbish, but was in a nice location on the roof, which was also a nice place for a sunset drink (byo). This seems like a nice old hotel that needs a big upgrade into the 21st century.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice”
Reviews.Author: dunckat
Reviews.Content: We were pleasingly supprised at the Gaslamp Plaza. A very old hotel that was quaint and friendly. Right in the middle of all the action. The room, I'm guessing, must have been an apartment in the early days. I could just imagine living there. The rooftop breakfast area was delightful. The view to die for. The entrance walls were marble. Very friendly and accommodating staff....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the Gaslamp quarter”
Reviews.Author: fyrfly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from M-F while attending a conference. We booked a mini-suite. The room was nice. It had a king bed and a sofa that might have been a pull out couch. The bed was comfortable. There was a small desk with desk lamp, a flat screen TV, and DVD player. You could rent DVDs for $6. Internet was $10 per day or $20 per week. There was a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and sink in the mini kitchen. The shower liner was an opaque beige so the light was a bit too muted in the bathroom. Everything was very clean and the people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. We were on the second floor facing E st and the corner of 5th, room 205. On Wed and Thurs we could hear the band playing at the corner bar but it wasn't too bad. Weekends might be a bit louder. The wine bar downstairs was worth going to. The rooftop seating area was very nice to sit and enjoy a bottle of wine. No fitness room but they direct you to a gym that you can go to for $8 per day. I would stay here if in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything that you would need in a downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: japlatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of the good reviews that it has received. I was in a wedding at another downtown hotel but the Gaslamp Plaza Suites was half the price. It is in a very convenient location to the trolley, airport bus and all the bars/restaurants in the Quarter. I was a bit surprised by how much the area reminded me of Bourbon Street especially on Saturday night. So be advised that there are lots of young, drunk people milling about at night there. The hotel itself was perfect for what I needed. My room was kind of an odd lay out without much natural light but I wasn't there much during the day so it didn't matter too much. I probably would have given the place 5 stars if I'd had a brighter, more open room but I can't really complain given the price. Everything was new and super clean which makes me very happy. They have nice touches like a full set of dishes, refrigerator, microwave, dvd player. All that makes it very comfortable. A free breakfast on their nice roof top is also a big plus. Simple, continental style - cereals, toast, muffins, coffee, juice, fruit-but still nice to have. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location & concierge”
Reviews.Author: Ledette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the midst of all that's happening downtown in Gaslamp Quarter as well as conveniently located to enjoy San Diego. The parking price of $28/night informed our decision of not renting a car. We found that to be the best option for this location. Public transportation was easy to use as we visited all the sites we'd planned to - zoo, Coronado Island, Tijuana, Seaport Village, Mission/Fashion Valley shopping, Mission & Ocean Beaches ... we met friends at the end of our week to attend a jazz concert at Anthology (walking distance) and we used our last full day in town to ride in their car to LaJolla. The rooftop hosts a spectacular view. We would have liked more healthful choices for the continental breakfast ... however, it is free. There's a grocery store nearby as well as a coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave in the room. Merry, the concierge, is a gem. Her insight helped to ensure our wonderful stay. We'll definitely be back. We've already recommended the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, avoid weekends”
Reviews.Author: jdandjm
Reviews.Content: What a charming heritage-listed building this is. After a long life as an office block it's now a both a hotel and timeshare, so every suite has a kitchenette. Fantastic location on the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter with its restaurants, theatres, bars, night clubs and other retail outlets. One block from the Horton Plaza shopping mall, two blocks from the trolley and not far to walk to the baseball stadium. A very basic but all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet is included and is available on the rooftop terrace. Great view over the Gaslamp Quarter, harbour and Coronado bridge. Not many other general facilities except WiFi in rooms, a single coin-op internet terminal (neither free) and a small book exchange. Room and dry cleaning service is available and there are some vending machines. Very helful tourist advice from the staff. No car park, so if you have a car, the local and valet parking is a little expensive. Even though our suite was one of the smaller ones in the building, it was still larger than many hotel rooms in this price range. Nicely decorated in vintage drapes and wall prints. The suite includes most of the expected facilities: comfortable QS bed, lounge, small dining suite, wardrobe, chests of drawers, desk with chair, two TVs (Cox-Analog 65 channels), two phones and a DVD player. What is missing is a dressing table and mirror. (The desk could double for this if there was a mirror.) Only one suitcase stand. The ensuite is large enough, but needs more towel rails and clothes hooks. The shower has no light so when the curtain is drawn, it's very dark. Plenty of high pressure hot water. Noise: A big issue on Friday and Saturday nights. There is a dull but tolerable roar from the street until about 2am. But we really lucked out when some of our nearby guests were here to party and created noise havoc in the corridor and in their rooms until about 4am. The glass doors and wooden internal walls offer little noise barrier. The hotel has signs everywhere: "THANK YOU FOR NOT SMOKING". They also need signs with: "THANK YOU FOR NOT SHOUTING, SWEARING AND SLAMMING DOORS". Generally we would recommend the Gaslamp Plaza Suites, but just be wary of weekends, and ask for a suite with a separate bedroom (it costs a little more) and is a long way from the elevator lobby. (Unless you are in town to party all night.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for San Diego trip”
Reviews.Author: KUgrad88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gaslamp Plaza Suites for 5 nights in July. The location is perfect. No car is needed! We took a cab from the airport ($15); and the hotel is within a block or two of the trolley stops and bus stops. Everyone at the front desk was so friendly. Sean, Merry and Dara really helped us out whenever we needed anything. Sean upgraded us to a fabulous room with 2 queen beds, full bath, tv in one room and a living room with a kitchenette, sofabed and full bath. Great when traveling with a teenaged girl -- she got her own bathroom!! We were in room 808. It is noisy at night in the Gaslamp district because that is the main social area. Lots of restaurants, bars etc. But it really didn't bother us. Go to the Urban Grill for dinner --fabulous (less than a block away) or Chocolat for super unique sandwiches, crepes, salads and yummy gelato. (about 3 blocks down 5th Street) The rooftop at the hotel is a great place to create your own happy hour. We took a bottle of wine and some cheese, fruit, crackers up there each night and had a great view of the bay and downtown. We met some wonderful people who also had the same idea. For the money, this place cannot be beat! We paid $131/night. I would absolutely stay there again -- if for nothing else, how relaxed we were up on the rooftop! Also, a trip to San Diego isn't complete without a visit to the zoo. It's expensive but worth it! We spent 7 hours there and still didn't see everything! My 17-year-old loved it!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of San Diego, what more could you want?!”
Reviews.Author: Izzyrose24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March and loved it. It is not your traditional room(s) which only made it more charming. It was noisy on Fri. nite, but you should just join the party! Very close to Horton Plaza. Don't miss Croce's Restaurant, but get the 2nd mortgage first! If you ever wondered what heaven might be like, SD is it and if I had to spend eternity at GPS that would be alright too! Stay here, you'll love it or you might want to think twice about where you will be serving eternity! Don't miss Balboa Park, they don't come any prettier and if you love dogs seek out Nate's Park at the beginning of the Prado. My dream is for my dog to be there one day, we can all dream! The little yellow cars are the best way to see SD, great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, Clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: ZWP
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for work and extended my stay for a couple of days at this hotel. The rooms are spacious. Like the fact that the bathroom is not next to the entrance (hate hotels like that). Has a microwave which is useful since I'm travelling alone and don't feel the need to eat at a restaurant. Hotel is in good location. Near MTS station. One bad thing about this hotel is that the rooms are not soundproof. In my room, I can hear sounds from the corridor, and I'm not referring to loud sounds but sounds like footstep sounds. Has complimentary breakfast but selection is limited. Only drinks (tea, coffee, juice, milk) and cereal, bread, muffins, donuts, etc. Have to pay to use the Internet but the speed is too slow and the connection frequently breaks down and I often have to re-connect.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in the heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: thisiskeng
Reviews.Content: Pros - Centrally located, next to restruants, shopping complex, shops and waterfront - Room was clean with one big bathroom, and another standard bathroom. - Small pantry allowed us to make some quick sandwich and soup for our kid. Cons - Our 1 bedroom unit was with a bit weird configuration, narrow, but long. Lack of naturaly light, and lighthing was not sufficient. - Expensive valet parking. We parked at a public garage 10 mins walk away, and paid only USD6. - Lobby looked old, and may scare you at the beginning - Noise from the street, if you stay on lower floor

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you like noisy drunken sailors”
Reviews.Author: johnuns
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you like noisy drunken sailors This is a difficult place to review. It is best to list the pros and cons. Proâ€™s 1) Nice rooms 2) For the most part friendly staff 3) The roof patio is quite nice. Conâ€™s 1) The street below was so noisy that sleep was impossible on Friday and Saturday night (Slightly better on Thursday and Sunday). The police came through clear out the streets at 3 and 3:30AM with their sirens on. (I'm from louisanna - and Bourbon St. isn't this bad.) 2) Breakfast is a joke â€“ They should not even bother 3) Valet parking is $28 a night and some time you have to wait ~ 15minutes for your car even if you called first. 4) Every time I waited for my car I was hit up by panhandlers 5) We had to checkout at 4AM to catch a flight and the night â€œpersonâ€� charged me for my room even thought it was pre-paid. Then started yelling at the computer â€“ double charged me for parking. He then to canceled the 1 charge and told me he needed another credit card because â€œthey â€œ would clear the 1st card. He was very unpleasant and we nearly missed our flight. 6) Funny smells (unpleasant) Overall â€“ I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It's difficult to give an accurate review.”
Reviews.Author: Betty_LOU_8
Reviews.Content: I suspect that it would be easier to write a review if we had stayed for only one or two nights, but we were there for 2 weeks. The location is great, it's close to bus and trolley stops and there are a lot of fabulous dining choices in the area. The front desk staff is also very friendly. The rooms are average. The couch and bed were both extremely uncomfortable which gets miserable after 2 weeks. The breakfast is all white processed stuff - bagels, bread, two kinds of cereal and sugary pastries and donuts. I imagine that we could have sucked it up for a couple of days but that too got tired after two weeks. I would have loved a piece of cheese or yogurt. A couple of morning we went to a nearby restaurant for breakfast. Overall, it's okay but no, I wouldn't stay there again, especially after I learned how easy it is to get around San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Rooms & Staff”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 20 years ago and really liked the location and rooms. 20 years later I can say the location and rooms and the best for the price. Each room is a mini suite with a living room area and kitchenette. Our room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast is included with the room, which is not very good unless you just want a cup of coffee, toast or cereal. The staff was very friendly and helpful when recommending places to eat. The best part is after you park your car you can walk to everything. There are sites, restaurants, clubs, the trolley all within walking distance. San Diego is a fun place and to be staying in the middle of it is a bonus. The only thing we did not like was there is a dance club on the lower floor of the building which the hotel does NOT own or operate. We went to the club and the staff at the club was rude to us. We are not young people and they were treating us like we were 20 years old trying to seek in with fake ID. We would suggest to avoid this club because there are so many other clubs that treat you right. FYI... we did not hear any noise from the club while we were in our room. If you going to San Diego we would suggest staying at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place!”
Reviews.Author: PatShaker
Reviews.Content: Located right in the Gaslamp district, this place offers value for money! We had a mini suite. Everything was very clean. Check-in took all of 3 minutes, check-out not even one! The rooftop is accessible all day long. It is where they serve breakfast every day, and we had dinner up there on a couple of occasions. Since they have all the dining ware necessary for a complete meal (wine glasses!), it is very easy to go get take-out at Horton Plaza, located 2 blocks from the hotel (there are also many restaurants in the district that offer that service). Great view of Coronado Bridge and Gaslamp buildings from the top. All in all, a very pleasant experience. Really looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: BOOBOO30
Reviews.Content: We booked this after we couldn't get in at the Sofia and it was a wonderful find! The staff were friendly and gave great advice on things to do, places to see etc. We had a mini suite for our stay which was very clean and nicely furnished. It had all the usual amenities plus a small kitchen area and a fabulous view of the Gaslamp area of San Diego. The serve a ver nice complimentary breakfast in the mornings on the fantastic roof top of the hotel. We spent a lot of time up there when we were in the hotel as the view was really delightful and no one else went up there! There is no restaurant on site at the moment but there should be one soon, not that its a problem as there are so many bars and restaurants within the area that the choice is endless.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Gaslamp, downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SallyC2
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, conveniently located in the Gaslamp in downtown. Close to Horton Plaza, various restaurants nearby. Friendly staff. Love the continental breakfast daily on the roof deck, overlooking downtown and Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Hx
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay here and will recommend to family going to San Diego. Room was extremely clean, plenty of space, decent shower, helpful staff. Valet service is very pricey though. This place is so close to many restaurants and a westfield about 2 small blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location lousy bed”
Reviews.Author: SailingCrew
Reviews.Content: This was an RCI exchange. As they say, "Location, Location, Location". If it were not for the great downtown location and the nice staff this vacation would have been a total disaster. Our room was very small but that was expected after reading the reviews. We were disappointed with the bed. It was very uncomfortable. We ended up leaving after 3 nights even though we were booked for 7. Our backs could not take it anymore. The staff was very good but we were disappointed that late comers were allowed to enter the orientation raffle after the rules were clearly defined and the entry window closed 30 minutes earlier. One lady whined and made a scene until Merry conceded. These kinds of people who feel entitled even when they don't follow the rules are what is wrong with this country. Even though I marked that I would recommend this hotel to a friend, I would give a loud warning about the size of the "hotel" rooms

Reviews.Title: “central Gaslamp Quarter location... right in the heart of the buzz”
Reviews.Author: roeboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights as part of our Californian holiday. Overall, I was very impressed. The room (610) we requested was massive by anyone's standards, the highlights being a huge marble sunken bathtub and state of the art climate control. The size and comfort of our room was an unexpected bonus as I had only chosen this property due to its location and price point. The property is slap bang in the Gaslamp Quarter which is the main entertainment and nightlife centre of Downtown SD. The area comprises a 16 block radius jam packed with shops/restaurants/bars. In this respect be careful what you are looking for from your vacation because this area in general can get a little roudy at night, especially at the weekends. This was fine by me as it affords you great nightlife on your doorstep without even having to dream about driving your car. However, if you are after a more sedate vacation then this hotel and perhaps area of downtown SD aint for you. The hotel itself is within walking distance to the harbour/seport village etc... while the trolley and bus stops/terminals are close enough by foot to help get you to various other attractions such as San Diego Zoo, Seaworld, Old Town, Mexico Border etc... Overall, I would reccomend this hotel without hesitation providing you are clued up on what the Gaslamp Quarter is and staying within such close proximity suits your needs. San Diego itself is a tremendous area to visit and when I am staying downtown again, this hotel will be on my shortlist

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rempt2
Reviews.Content: great vacation. we went with 2 adult children. We got 2 rooms (710 and 704). both were very spaciious although stuios. 704 had a living room/sofa couch). Really wonderful location. We went all over San Diego county from this place from Oceanside to the Mexican border via public transportation. If you are 60+ you can get month pass for $18 which covers bus and trolley. Very few places are not reachable. We went to Olympic Training Center in Eastlake and had to take taxi once but that's it. Merry from guest relation was awesome. Orientation from Monday is not to be missed. I would highly highly recomend this place for vacation. Some rooms maybe small but not on the 7th floor. we had great time at d'medici rest (ask for Victor).

Reviews.Title: “Turn of the Centruy Charm”
Reviews.Author: MaBear01
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, boutique hotel right smack dab in the middle of the Gaslamp Quarter, then this is the place to be. It is only 11 stories with 60 guest rooms/suites. It is charming and cozy. The rooms are quite small for a suite, but the fact that the building was once a bank building built in the mid 1900s, makes it so very interesting. Much of the original marble and brass have been preserved. My first thought when I entered the hall was that I was back in a black and white movie going to the office of a local attorney or the import/export company and I would see a secretary typing on an old manual Royal. Each suite is named for a different writer...Margaret Mitchell, Tennyson, Shelley, Keats. It combines old and new as there is a hot and bumping club in the basement. Restaurants abound as do local convenience stores and shops. Horton Plaza is right around the corner...a huge mall with everything at all prices. The valet guys are very accommodating and friendly and chatty; the front desk staff will help with whatever you need. We never saw the housekeeping staff, but their work was evident. My one little complaint...there was no hook on the back of the bathroom door to hang robes and nities. There were two nice flat-screen TVs in the deluxe one bedroom suite, a very comfortable queen size bed, a mini fridge coffeemaker, dinner and silverware and microwave. Because of its location, it can get noisy late at night as that part of town NEVER seems to sleep. So if you are looking for quite and solitude, this is not the place to be. It is convenient to many public bus lines and you can pick up most tours right on Broadway (one block away) and/or at Horton Plaza. A limited complimentary continental breakfast is served daily on the rooftop terrace overlooking downtown San Diego. The guests were friendly. Dakota's Restaurant (access from outside) provides room service when they are open. Wireless internet is in each room, but it's not free (about $10 per day or $20 per week). Paring is expensive too. It is a historical property and must be well maintained. (It is also a Resorts International timeshare property).

Reviews.Title: “$28/per night parking”
Reviews.Author: PirateGina
Reviews.Content: Parking is not included in your hotel cost, it's $28/PER NIGHT to park in valet and $20 a night to find your own parking...which is almost impossible on a Friday and Saturday night. Parking meter's almost guarantee a $30 ticket. This hotel is right in the center of all the cool bar's and night clubs, walking distance to shopping and good food. The hotel room's are suites that are elongated like old office buildings.Our room 608 had a small fridge,microwave,sink and included plates/silverware/and a few extra cooking supply's for the microwave.....good if your staying more then a few nights. Our room was large and comfy (bed's were just okay in comfort level) There is so much going on in San Diego Saturday nights that the rooms are kinda loud...lots' of sirens and horns from the bussle at night down stairs (might bother some people). The continental breakfast was just okay, only a few doughnuts,muffins,coffee and OJ.

Reviews.Title: “The most convenient location I'd ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: traveler4times
Reviews.Content: Old world class with all the modern conveniences you need. Rooms were very clean but the couches were a little worn. We are used to kitchen facilities, but the mini bar with the microwave was enough. There was a large grocery about 4 blocks away. Huge food court in the mall one block away. Just absolutely close to everything; Marina, convention center, civic center, attractions. San Diego has an excellent public transportation system. You can hop on the trolly a block away and go to Old Town, the stadium, or just about anywhere you want to go. We drove to the marina district most of the time, but mainly because parking was easy; even with cruise ships in and out. If you are going for a week, I would suggest calling around to the parking companies and find one close to the hotel and get a two week pass. It is cheaper than daily parking. The only thing that was a problem for us was the late night sirens and street music til 2am on 5th street the "IN" place to be for night life. But that would be with any inner city hotel. But we still enjoyed the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gaslamp Location for Restaurants and entertainment.”
Reviews.Author: brigandbob
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for restaurants, entertainment, night life and shopping at Horton Plaza. Close to bus routes, trolley, Amtrac and Coaster trains. Rooms are spacious and spotless (some night time revelry noise but this is the Gaslamp Quarter.) Our suite had a fridge, microwave and complete kitchen facilities. The front desk staff are extremely courteous and helpful. On monday mornings, after your complementary continental breakfast (provided every morning on the rooftop garden and quite adequate to start your day) Merry, a front desk staff member, gives a tourist briefing (complete with prize draws; she then conducts a walking tour of the immediate Gaslamp Quarter; all included in your hotel booking. A good base for fun and sightseeing in San Diego We will stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Harry2blue
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 2 weeks at this resort. We had a really great time. The resort is in the best location - ever. We could walk to the restaurants, which was great in the evenings. The units themselves are more spacious than I thought they would be from the reviews. We had exchanged 4 weeks of a 2 bed timeshare for 2 weeks of studios x 2 - but it was worth it. They are like very large hotel rooms. 2 members of staff I have to mention. The first is Merry who really made our holiday for us. She is a real gem and has worked there for 16 years - she knows everything. We must have asked her a question everyday but she never lost patience. She also gave us loads of vouchers which saved us about 150 dollars for the 4 of us - we seemed to have a voucher for everything - supplied by Merry of course. The other member of staff was our wonderful cleaner who came in every day and really helped to make my holiday a rest. There is only one thing that would make it better - if it had it's own pool but that is being a bit picky. I looked at the reviews before going and a few were off putting so it was all a great surprise. The valet parking being 28 dollars is a bit of a bone of contention but it is the cheapest way to park as you have unlimited access to your car.After reading the reviews we parked in a public car park next door on the first day but that was 20 dollars for 12 hours which would have meant getting up at 6am on our first day. So use the valet parking is my advice. Another thing we did not realise that our kitchen would be so limited we would have to go out to eat all the time which of course worked out very expensive- so take plenty of money. The breakfast on the roof was great every morning and is free - so make sure you take advantage. There was a only a couple of times that we didn't like what was on offer. Not bad in 2 weeks. Overall it was a great holiday experience .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: kg0022g
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Merry at the front desk is very welcoming and helpful. The hotel has an orientation with a raffle which I thought was a nice touch. A walking tour of the surrounding area was given by Merry which was really enjoyable. The room was very clean and sufficient for our needs. The continental breakfast is good and there is a great view from the top floor. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: CaCruiser05
Reviews.Content: The Gaslamp Plaza Suites is in the best part of the Gaslamp District. All the best restaurants and pubs are within walking distance as well as the new Padre stadium and the best shopping mall. There is no reason to cook when you can go any direction and find great food at all prices. Do you like to eat indoors or sit out on the sidewalk dining areas? It's all there. The mini suites at the resort are very elegant. Nothing cheap about them. Eventhough you are in the heart of the city, the double pane windows do a great job of keeping out the street sounds. The staff is very informative and answer all your questions about things to do in the area. I recommend a day at Sea World or drinks and dinner at Dick's Last Resort (crazy & fun). The Gaslamp Plaza Suites is nostalgic too. Has a cool old-time elevator that looks like it came out of a ritsy hollywood hotel from the 30's. Parking is an extra charge, but you can rely on the cable cars, Amtrack or taxis. I rode the Amtrack down to the Gaslamp for New Years Eve a few years back so didn't need a car since we passed on touring around.

Reviews.Title: “When in San Diego, stay here”
Reviews.Author: JazboOttawa
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in the San Diego Tourist guide. Great rooms, reasonable breakfast, the Dakota restaurant is very nice, the location is perfect. If you prefer the quiet life, stay elsewhere, but if you want a great suite in the heart of a great neighbourhood in a great city, this is the one. The highlight of our stay was Mary on the front desk, friendly, helpful, knowlegeable.....

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable and the location is terrific.”
Reviews.Author: SEAchange
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites and my stay there was great. The room was comfortable, clean, nicely appointed and equipped and the location in the Gaslamp Quarter is great. Close to Petco Park, the harbour, transportation to the Zoo, Balboa Park and Old Town and great shopping at Horton Plaza. Right in the midst of the Gaslamp Quarter. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful - including rooftop orientations for guests to the attractions of San Diego. Really wonderful. About the only suggestion I would make is that the continental breakfast could be beefed up a little. A few more choices would certainly have been welcome. It is pretty basic and bland. How about adding some low carb choices like hard cooked eggs? All in all, though, a very pleasant hotel stay and I will definitely choose it again when I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great accomodating staff - really helpful”
Reviews.Author: malm1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while my husband went to a conference at the Westin. The location is great for downtown. You can walk all over. The first night we had very small rooms on the 3rd floor. I had booked two rooms for our family of 5, each room with a double bed and a sofa bed. It was terribly noisy because of the street noise. So the next morning I talked to the staff and they moved us to the 8th and 7th floor. Then each room had 2 double beds and a sofa bed in a separate room with 2 bathrooms. That was perfect. The bathrooms are old, but they were okay on the upper floors, they were sort of yucky on the 3rd floor rooms. The lighting is very bad in the hotel, it is a little dim and the switches all seem to be in the wrong spots! The staff was great. I found a coupon for Legoland that got 4 of us in for a total of 63 dollars. I sent the front desk a pdf and they printed it off for me. I paid for the valet parking, but there is actually a parking lot next door to the hotel that would have been more than adequate for us. The rooftop breakfast was really nice. It was not upmarket, but the view was great. When I asked for hot cocoa for the kids they gave it to us.

Reviews.Title: “If you like bright fresh smelling rooms with a desk to work at this is not a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: sevensons
Reviews.Content: The first room we were showed $133.00 inclusive of tax was so tiny there was barely 18 inches of space between the wall and the bed on both sides. There was no desk to write at. It was very very dark with a small frosted window (3 feet by 4.5 feet). The doors to the hall are all a wooden frame of about 9 inches around with a 5 foot by 1.5 foot frosted glass insert. When we indicated this wouldn't do we were given another room which was brighter and larger but still quite dark and also with a glass door. The paint is a dark beige with gold and wine coloured borders throughout. They told us it was a historical building and therefore everthing was governed by the time period. The staff was very nice and tried to accomodate us by giving us the better room but it was much more expensive--$160.00. I am more interested in a bright clean room than in being in a historical landmark that is very dark and has old smells so for me the choice was very disappointing. If you are into history maybe it would be for you. The staff was very helpful and friendly. also the street noise was very loud and you could hear everything in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel within easy reach of restaurants”
Reviews.Author: cheshirepen
Reviews.Content: Easy to find on the boundary of the Gaslamp District of San Diego but nevertheless within very easy walking distance of the restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp area. Comfortable room but a bit full of furniture. Had a sink and basic kitchen facilities (this place is clearly a timeshare place). Bathroom clean and functional. Good view from the room over San Diego. Continental breakfast was very basic - one of the worst we had on our trip. Valet parking worked well. Helpful reception staff. One of the more expensive places we stayed at during our trip but we had better value at some cheaper places. Overall, do give this place consideration for location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: traveleasy60
Reviews.Content: The city is only a short drive from the airport to the city so we soon arrived at the Gas Lamp Plaza on E Street and we were greeted by a lovely receptionist called Merry, she was most helpful and gave us lots of information about the city. All the recption staff were pleasant and helpful The rooms are not gigantic but they are adequate and very well looked after, the maid service was second to none. The building is a converted office block from the turn of the centuary but this only adds to its feeling. Lots of the original features have been retained and used in the building. A complimentary breakfast is served on the rooftop every morning. It is not a big breakfast but enough to start the day. Everyone was most helpful and pleasant and we would stay there again if going back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative To The Chain Hotels”
Reviews.Author: gandgturner
Reviews.Content: A perfect location (walk to Balboa Park, Petco Park, and the waterfront), great room, and loads of charm. We enjoy small, older hotels like this since they have so much character compared to the many large national chains in the area. I would suggest going up on the roof for the views, but not the breakfast (limited in selection and quality,,,the coffee was undrinkable.). Fortunately there are lots of fine restaurants in the area, so you won't go hungry. As for the street noise that has been mentioned in some reviews...why are you staying in the middle of the biggest nightlife area in a major city if you are concerned with noise?? We closed the windows and had a no issues with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadsCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in August 2008. Room/suite on 9th floor was big and with a small kitchenette (nice with the fridge). The room was facing the habour and the downtown streets which gave a bit of noise friday and saturday night. But this was not a problem for us. Otherwise just a wonderful view. Bathroom with tub was ok. Nothing fancy but just as needed. Breakfast was served at the roof teraace which is absolutely wonderful! Great view of the city- escpeically during the evening. Fantastic. Breakfast was nothing specialt (maybe a bit too many cakes:)) but we managed fine. Location is wonderful. Everything is just outside and the hotel offered parkering (charged) which we used. Lots of restaurants, bars, a mall etc is just around the corner. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Macfamilyd4
Reviews.Content: We ( myself, my husand and 2 kids) stayed here and found the hotel great. The location is right in the heart of downtown with plenty of restaurants and shops within a minutes walk. The room was very large and airconditioned, beds were very comfortable and everything spotlessly clean. Breakfast is on the rooftop dining area which gives great views of San Diego. The Zoo is approx 10 mins drive and the port area another 5 mins drive away. I read comments from other travellers about homeless people around the area and yes there are some but they dont bother anyone and were not in the immediate area of the hotel street. There is a bar accross the street which we thought might prove noisy but we heard nothing! I would recommend it to anyone who wants a good base to explore San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay If You Like Downtown Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Retirees
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week through an RCI exchange and this place rocks! We're older retired couple in our 60's and it was a bit noisy some nights but soon got used to it. The suite was grand with a large sitting room, ample bedroom with queen bed, great views of the city (we were on the eighth floor) and complementary breakfast on the roof. The downtown location negates need for a car as buses and trolleys are always available. Senior rate on either is $1 for one way trip. Trolleys go to Old Town, Little Italy and Tijuana (need passport) while buses can take you to Balboa Park/San Diego Zoo (#7) the Coronado Ferry (#2) or directly to Coronado (#901). Bus #30 services the Birch Aquarium and La Jolla village. PETCO park is within walking distance. We had a great time at a nightclub called Shout with dualing piano players on 4th St and Patricks II around the corner from Croces. Horton Plaza with Macys, Nordstroms and many other shops is one block away. A Ralphs supermarket is also close by as well as several other smaller markets. If you want to rent a car for a day or two the trolley (Blue Line) will take you directly to many car rental places at the Middletown stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy outside on weekends”
Reviews.Author: Oceancat
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a meeting and stayed at Gaslamp Plaza Suites for 5 nights. The hotel is neat--I actually liked the frosted glass hallways. My room was a good size and the bathroom was art-deco-ey. The hotel is in a great spot for enjoying the Gas Lamp district and close to the bus stop to get out to Balboa Park and the Zoo. The rooftop deck was nice, and there was breakfast up there (nothing to brag about). My issues with the hotel were the just average quality of the linens (for $279/nt I expect nicer sheets and towels)--not a lot better than a motel 6 in that department. The soaps and such were also pretty cheap (again for the price I paid, I expected more). I had a room on the 8th floor that faced the bars and on Sat. night in particular, it was loud, but I turned on the a/c and that helped to drown out the noise. The rest of the nights the noise was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lock up your valuables!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjanddavid
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week at the Gaslamp Plaza and felt I needed to share this information with others who may be considering this location. It is in a great location, however if you are not a sound sleeper, it is very loud at night. Because of the downtown location, there are people wandering throughout the hotel and there is no security to prevent someone from entering. From 11 pm - 7 am the doors are locked, but any other time, anyone can enter. We had items stolen from our room while we were out for supper one evening. So make sure you take your valuables with you!!!! Then the most disappointing part about this is that the hotel would take no responsibilty for it. I had spoke to another couple who had items stolen from their room the previous week. The items can be replaced, but it was a terrible feeling to know someone had entered our room. This hotel is also very old and the rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: davsaz
Reviews.Content: Well, I don't know where to start. First off, the hotel is beautiful and in a great location. However, my first two nights were spent in a studio which was ONE tiny room. The glass door (with some type of clouded glass and curtain) was right in front of my bed. I was scared. I was traveling alone on business, and I opened the closet door to hide half of the glass door, stacked my suitcase next to that, and then piled pillow on top of pillow to prevent anyone from peeking in. Now, I really don't think that anyone could have peeked in, but I was paranoid. Plus there was a window, but again, it had this weird glass and there was nothing but an alley with no light/ceiling whatsoever. The rooftop was incredible. I went up there every morning for the continental breakfast. They also finally, after two nights, moved me up to a larger studio on the 8th floor (albeit I did have to pay more). The staff was very nice. I did wonder about the security, especially since I went to the lower lobby one night to get a soda...and couldn't figure out what/who/what/why the club room doors were for. The whole gaslamp area is beautiful, but it is full of homeless people. They really don't bother you, but again, being alone on business, I was sort of scared. All in all, it is a beautiful hotel, although DO NOT GET A Studio on 204, 304, 504, 404 or 604. Other than that, I'm sure it is great. My new studio was actually two rooms with lots of mirros which were great to control my claustrophobia.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but was noisy”
Reviews.Author: marincountybosun
Reviews.Content: stayed one night (although booked for four), and left due to noise from street. Although had requested higher floor at time of booking in August 2007 to avoid noise, was given room on 2nd floor. At check-in asked again for higher floor, but none available. After one noisy night (music from local club from 8 pm to 12:30 am on Thursday night, and flags whipping against building) again asked for higher floor but again none available, so went to other nearby hotel and slept fine for rest of stay. Other than noise, room was fine, well-appointed with mini-fridge, microwave, plates, bowls, cups, glasses, cutlery. Staff were friendly. The free continental breakfast was basic, but quantity good. (Wished we could have stayed on a higher floor; it might have been quieter?)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location And Very Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbie1999
Reviews.Content: The Location is awesome. Within walking distance to all restaurants and bars with great entertainment.
