We had a one bedroom suite on the third floor with a magnificent view of the strip. The Gas Lamp Plaza Suites a very lovely hotel. Very well kept. We ate at the Dakota Grill and the food was delicious. We were also given a ten dollar discount on the back of our room key. To top off our awesome anniversary weekend at the Gas Lamp Plaza Suites was i had left behind my $250 ipod. I was so bummed when i got home. I call the lost and found and left my info. The next morning Shaun called me and told me that Lupe Moreno had turned in my ipod. They will be shipping it to me by fed ex. I can not ask for a better anniversary weekend.Thank you so much "Gas Lamp Suites" You made my anniversary one to always "remember". I will definitely come back over and over and over again. First class place and first class people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cgbm73
Reviews.Content: I love this place! The room was amazing and the location was perfect! The valet/bell staff was really helpful. The room and the bathroom are large and very comfy. The hotel is located in the middle of the gaslamp quarter so if noise bothers you I would not recommend this place. I was less than impressed with the front desk staff. Although, it didn't really affect my stay because the other staff was extremely nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: iwork4u247
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites for 2 days as part of a Fathers Day trip for our parents that we booked. My husband and I travel to San Diego a couple times a year, and were pleasently surprised with not only the hotel itself, but the price, and how convenient the location was. We opted for the smallest room which was about $100, our parents got the larger rooms ranging up to $ 150. There is a lovely continental breakfast in the morning up on the roof top, and at night the view from the roof top was a awesome. The staff was great and helpful. We were able to walk to everything (shopping & restaurants are very close). We all ate at Sammy's Wood Fired Pizza, which the food was very good, great variety and prices were reasonable, and the Hard Rock... everything was so close which my husband and I like. The only drawbacks to note are that since the location is central to all the nightlife, there can be some noise issues, depending where your room is and Parking is by Valet, or you can find parking elsewhere. In San Diego this is expected, so be ready to pay either way, but it is not too bad at the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and for the price I could not beat it, and we all enjoyed ourselves and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LJH2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza for 7 nights in August. The hotel is right in the heart of everything & so close to Horton Plaza. We didn't hire a car but still managed to go to Seaworld, The Zoo, Coronado & La Jolla on public transport. We also got a coach tour to DisneyLand. The roof terrace is certainly a plus point. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: kc8224
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites for 3 nights in late July in a Junior Suite (1 bedroom). Found the hotel to be what I had expected based on previous reviews. Excellent location for downtown without a car. Nice staff. Hotel is older but well kept. Breakfest is minimal. Very good value for the location. Noisy on Sat. night but I am a heavy sleeper so this was not a problem. My only complaint was that I found the beds to be way to soft. Other than that I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old-style hotel, good location but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: retiredteacherstwo
Reviews.Content: This was an old hotel which had some style. Staff were pleasant and fairly helpful, and our suite was a good size and comfortable. The furniture and bathroom were a bit dated, but were clean and the facilities were adequate. It was good to have access to the roof terrace at any time. Breakfast was fairly limited though, and the use of flimsy paper cups and plates seemed a bit cheap and nasty - and also dangerous, as eating on the terrace was often very breezy. (By the way, despite what the hotel staff say, the roof is NOT a good place from which to view Fourth of July fireworks!) The hotel is in a good position for trams and buses, but unfortunately also for night-clubs, and we found sleeping difficult. In spite of the criticisms we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but in good location”
Reviews.Author: honesttripreviewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Gaslamp Plaza for 2 nights in June 2007. Family of 4 including 2 teenage daughters. The specific type of suite we had booked in February with 2 bathrooms (because of 3 girls) was not available upon arrival because the people staying there before us "decided to stay longer." Never heard that excuse before, but that was the explanation. We had confirmed this same suite just 2 days prior to be sure it was available. They did offer other alternatives and we did finally decide to stay in a suite at a discounted rate, but only with one bathroom. They also offered a bottle of wine. The hotel is in a great location. Glad we stayed in town. The hotel is historic, so if you are looking for a modern hotel with amenities, this is not the place. It is dated, dark hallways and small rooms, but clean. The street noise level can be an issue with lots of bars around, but fortunately we were on one of the highest floors. The rooftop was a nice place to go sit or have breakfast, but the food was very basic (coffee, juice, 2 dry cereal choices and either donuts or muffins and bagels. No fruit or warm options but just enough. To give you some comparison, we did stay in an Embassy Suites and a Homewood Suites during this same trip in other parts of California. The Gaslamp does not match up to these hotels. I don't think my family would stay here again, but, if you are looking for very basic accomodations in a good location at a price less than the big chains, this might suit your needs. We would likely stay at the Embassy Suites, Hyatt or Omni next time. If you do visit San Diego and you like Italian food, you do have to visit Filippis. I had read all the great reviews, so we decided to try it. My family about left when we walked up and saw it, but once you walk thru the market area in the front, there is a nice, very casual restaurant with great pasta or pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: beltman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights in mid-May. Only five miles from the airport. Disn't rent or feel the need for a car. Great location in Gaslamp, close to resturants,bars, Petco Park(walked to a ballgame). Just my wife and I, so plenty of room in the studio. Older building with character. Rooms clean and well kept. On the tenth floor, so little problem with street noise. Merry was great, and tipped us off to the "senior Citizen bus pass". took the buses and trolley's to Coronado Beach, Old Town, Balboa Park. San Diego Zoo great for the day. Whether was OK, "Grey May", no sun but comfortable for walking and siteseing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in the middle of GasLamp District”
Reviews.Author: bea54
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night due to sheduling details, but I enjoyed my stay very much. Check in was quick and they have a friendly helpful staff manning it. The suite was a king on the sixth floor, high enough to not be bothered by traffic noise. The suite was clean and comfortable. The doors have the old fashion doorhandles and the bathroom had real faccets and a real porcelin tub that you hardly ever see any more. This is any old building that was fixed up but kept the favor of the time it was build. The rooftop patio is a great place to chill out at the end of the day and to start your day with their breakfast. Nothing special but a good quick start breakfast. I called done for extra coffee for the coffeemaker in my room and I had hardly hung up the phone and someone was at the door with the coffee. It was that quick, he must have answered the phone from the elevator. Now it does not have a pool ,whirlpool or any of the other amenties that the other hotel have but it makes up for it in atmosphere and the view from the rooftop patio. All in all you could spend more and get alot less in the Gaslamp district. It is right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Downtown San Diego Ca”
Reviews.Author: rickki6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites from 3/3 to 3/9. The hotel is a bit old, room was ok, outdated & old style. We had the junior suite which was too much room for us. Only had queen bed. If you want a king you will need to stay in a studio, we should have done that instead of the suite. Our room # was 608 which was great as no noise at night, that is the busy time in the district. The hotel is a perfect location, walk a few blocks to the Convention Center to catch the trams, ferry to Coronado Island and visit the Seaport. Getting around is very easy. The Gaslamp District is only a handful of blocks surrounded by restaurants & a mall down the block. Reminds me of a nicer, cleaner Manhattan but we did notice a lot of homeless people and some blocks are a little seedy. This was one of the cheapest hotels I could find that was right in the district so we didnt need to rent a car, $179 per night for 2 people and we stayed there off season. Now that I have visited San Diego, I would have stayed in the Marriott or Hyatt, much nicer and right along the Bay even thought more money (tram stops in front of these hotels and convention center). Staff at the Gaslamp hotel were nice, friendly, young. You have a restaurant downstairs which we did not eat at and internet access in the room but downside is you have to pay for it. Cost us $20 for the time we stayed. All in all I would say the hotel is nothing great, not really my taste but it was clean & served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: jpahter
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Gaslamp Plaza Suites had highs and lows, but overall this is a reasonable value for a downtown stay. The Suites are wonderfully located for shopping and dining in the Gaslamp District. The rooms are updated, clean, relatively spacious if a bit oddly laid out, probably due to the state of planning in 1913 when it was built. Continental breakfast is include on the 10th floor rooftop, both inside and outdoors, although the facility has a worn look. The room price, at a couple of notches lower than the typical downtown hotel, made it somewhat attractive. On the downside, the desk staff seemed a bit dazed and confused about their duties. Calling for different services, which in most other hotels direct connects you to the valet or room service or housekeeping, will likely get you whoever is sitting at the front desk and it is potluck as to whether or not your wish will be communicated! Parking is atrociously expensive, but you have the option of self-parking within a block or two. Lastly, rooms facing 5th or E street may suffer from some late night noise from the clubs at street level. Not a bad place to stay, and particularly if you value a convenient downtown location. Stay away if you can't deal with the downside issues mentioned above though.

Reviews.Title: “We were delighted!”
Reviews.Author: duqette
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but wish we could have stayed longer. Charming room, incredible location right in the Gaslamp Quarter, and fantastically friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kajowisconsiin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December. It was fabulous. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. Good directions for local sights. It was easy to walk to anything in town, the rapid transit was easily assessible. We did have a car, and it cost extra to park at night, but for the money it was definately worth it. We had a one bedroom suite on the ninth floor, and we had no problem with noise at all. Some other people we met at breakfast, said they had noise late at night in their room. The breakfast buffet on the rooftop was fabulous. Sitting and relaxing and overlooking the ocean----what more can I say. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't drive, but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BayouGuy
Reviews.Content: We really like the location of the gas lamp plaza. Close to a lot of bars, although it can get noisy on the weekend if youre close to the street. every employee was nice and friendly, especially mary who took us on a tour on monday morning. Only bad thing is parking- $21 a night!! And we found out you can get everywhere with the buses and trolleys, so DON'T DRIVE! But a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Happy that we stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Lindaray
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites. Our suite was a mini on the 8th floor and was tasteful, comfortable and clean. It suited our needs just fine because our trip was to experience San Diego and all that goes with it, not to stay in a hotel room. Housekeeping services was very good. and the staff was pleasant and helpful. We visited many areas of the City by walking or using public transportation. The weather was great and if your stay is to enjoy the City there is no necessity to rent a vehicle nor is there any need to worry about where to eat. There are plenty of restaurants of great variety. Places to visit are Coronado, Old Towne, Seaport Village, the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park. Our next visit will include LaJolla. We enjoyed the view from the rooftop and took advantage of the continental breakfast served there every morning. We recommend that you do stay at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites. Our travel experience has been that no matter where you go, your vacation is all that you make it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: nome124
Reviews.Content: I was up on top..while the few employees came down from the elevator shaft after smoking marijuana, I would not recomend this hotel to anyone with Family! They need to give there emplyees a DRUG TEST.

Reviews.Title: “Olde worlde charm”
Reviews.Author: nicglecar
Reviews.Content: My wife and i revisited this establishment for the second time after a five year gap, and it was just as good as the first visit. From the beautiful glass panelled elevators to the tastefully furnished rooms, the whole place exudes an air of class. Very friendly desk staff. excellent maid service and generally spotless appearance all add to the ambiance. Complimentary breakfast on the roof terrace, with lovely views across the city in the early morning is a nice way to start the day. Location for nightbirds is wonderful, with most bars, clubs, restaurants within easy walking distance. A note of caution for the light sleeper though, it does get very noisy at night (fri-sat untill at least 3.00am) In summary, we would highly recommend the gaslamp plaza suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: bhawbill
Reviews.Content: Great location.It is close to all the major attractions in the San Diego area and is right in the heart of Gaslamp District.The only drawback was the$20 per night to park

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lonnie204
Reviews.Content: In the heart of downtown. Near the city action if you like shopping, lots of restaurants, and night spots. Noisy at night due to the traffic and crowds of young revelers enjoying themselves. We went to the zoo and Seaworld from here. We used city transit. The staff gave decent, accurate directions on which trolley and/or bus to take and where to get on and off. Riding big city transit can be interesting. It takes the burden off of driving in the city and gives me a chance to relax and check out the scenery. We only travelled on the transit system during the day. The hotel was average/old.

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Plaza Suites - A True Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug55
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the Gaslamp District - the Gaslamp Plaza Suites is in walking distance to all the fabulous night life that the area has to offer. Make sure to read the history about this remarkable building and marvel in the architectual spendor of its marble laced walls and beveled glass elevators - simply stunning! Oh, and don't forget to catch the views from the Gaslamp Club located on the 10th floor of the building - it will knock your socks off. Wonderful and superior service - my husband & I have saved this one to our "Favorites List" - I'm sure we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. The location was excellent. You are right downtown, just a block from the trolley and minutes from all the downtown restaraunts and shops. The only downside was that it can be noisy at night. Certainly not the hotel's fault, but just beware you are right in the middle of all the action. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to San Diego and I was not happy with the downtown hotel prices but Gaslamp, while not the cheapest, offered a very nice room and an excellent location. Right in the heart of the district, we could walk to any restaurant, one block to the Horton Plaza, one block to the trolley and bus stops and a longer but doable walk to the waterfront. Also, walked home from the zoo. We upgraded to a one bedroom but i'm not sure that was necessary -- the minisuites looked fine. We really enjoyed having breakfast every morning on the rooftop overlooking downtown and the water. Merry was very friendly and helpful finding us a convertible mustang to rent. The valet offered great service. Room was clean and hot water was never a problem. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place -- We're Coming Back!”
Reviews.Author: BenzDad
Reviews.Content: Whenever my wife and I travel to San Diego, we always stay at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites. The rooms have wonderful, old-world charm that transport you back to another era. Why stay in a nondescript overpriced room at the Hyatt or Marriott when you can give yourself a truly unique and memorable experience at the GPS? The staff is upbeat, friendly and extremely helpful. The morning brunches on the rooftop offer a great view over the city. Throw in the fact that you're within easy walking distance of the most exciting part of town and you're assured of a great time. In short, this place rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Yes, Yes......book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgzshopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one week.......The service in this hotel is beyond anything I have had in the past. Everyone wants you to have a good time and will go out of their way to see that you do. Yes, Merry was a real gem......she made us laugh everyday and knew the area, the history and the good restaurants to eat at. She gives a free walking tour on Monday morning. She was always there to give us some money off coupons or directions. The room we had on the 9th floor was wonderful. We had two full bathrooms, two queen size beds and a living area. The room was kept clean and we were not distrubed by noisy maids or knocking on the door early to see if they could come in. The free breakfast on the roof top was fine for a quick start. Everyday they had different bakeries but the cereal and toast sections were the same. It was fine. Just sitting in the morning looking out at the view of the harbor was worth its weight in gold. We had a get together party with cider, cheese, crackers and chips the first day we arrives. It was a nice touch to meet the other guests in the hotel. One night some of us went up to the roof top for our own wine and cheese party with the guests we had meet. Everyone at this hotel is concerned that you have a good time. If something needed attention, it was fixed and fixed fast........Everyone was pleasant and happy. Location, location, location.........this is the place if you want to be in the action. It has everything you need. We rented a car and only used one tank of gas doing our sights. The only bad thing is it can get noisey on the weekends but it really did not bother us as we were on a high floor..........

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Goldenchic
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Gaslamp Plaza Suites. We had an upper floor mini-suite, and found the room to be beautiful, spacious and clean! The view was amazing and the staff was very helpful! We thoroughly enjoyed breakfast and evenings on the roof-top-wonderful view of the city and Petco Park from one corner...The location was superb..we walked to many attractions and the public transportation was closeby and efficient..We never rented a car for our entire stay! Special kudos to Merry-the Activities Director-she is a gem! She could not help us enough and we enjoyed her sparkling personality.... I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the gaslamp district. There is easy access to everything through public transportation or taxis. (San Diego Zoo was $6 dollars including tip, bus was $4.50 for two.) The breakfast was very basic but nice to have to start out the morning. The staff was very pleasant and helpful with questions. The hotel is small enough that you feel that they get to know you. The rooms were old but had a unique feel as well as being clean and comfortable. Our view from the tenth floor suite was awesome. I felt very comfortable with our five day stay. If you are someone who likes to be close to the action, this is an economical place to stay. It does get a bit loud at night, especially on the weekend, but we did not mind.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Insomniacs!”
Reviews.Author: 12journey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Gaslamp Plaza Suites. The price was reasonable & it was in a great location. Breakfast was included on the rooftop, consisting of cold cereals, juice, coffee & bagles or bread. The furniture was a bit worn, especially the sofa sleeper. Had a microwave, little bar & mini refrigerator. The downside was it was right in the middle of the nightlife section. At night it was crawling with people bar hopping & partying until after 2 AM & we stayed in the middle of the week. There was a bar with a loud band playing that vibrated the windows until the wee hours of the morning. So, if you're a very sound sleeper, I guess this place would work for you, otherwise find a quiter location. Kris H. Colorado

Reviews.Title: “checked out right after we checked in”
Reviews.Author: nancy58
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the most unkept hotels we have seen in all our years of travelling. The window was so dirty that we could not get light through it. The bed for two was up against the wall and the carpets and bedspread was very unclean looking. One elevator had trapped people in it the day before so only one was working. It felt like a firetrap. We booked on Hotwire and it was said to be a three star. We had to forfeit our $200.00 but it was worth it not to have to open up the bed and see what the sheets looked like.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, homey, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're a fan of unique, historic hotels, stay at The Gaslamp Plaza Suites. We paid $149 for a 9th floor room with a harbor view (Mini-Suite Higher Floor) and were quite happy with our stay. The bed was comfortable, front desk staff helpful, and the building was charming. The included breakfast on the rooftop terrace was a treat, though the breakfast selections are limited (health-food fanatics beware) and the air-conditioner compressors are kind of noisy. Some reviews have mentioned a roof-top hot tub...there isn't one there, now. Two major pluses of this hotel: location and kitchenette. The hotel is one block from major bus lines, two blocks from the trolley, and within an easy walk to many good restaurants. This means you can get to La Jolla, Old Town, the zoo, beaches, the convention center, sports facilities...without renting a car and paying the $20 nightly car park fee. Also, a taxi from the airport is about $11 (without tip). If you come back to the hotel too pooped to drag yourself to a restaurant, you can stop at a nearby convenience store or take-out and sit on the sofa in your pajamas while eating dinner and watching TV. Yes, street noise can be a problem, but (apart from a couple of car horns on the weekend) it didn't disturb our sleep at all. The hotel feels quite safe, but be aware that downtown San Diego has a sizable homeless population--some with mental problems--so this area might feel a bit "rough" to some people. However, as an urban-dwelling woman, I didn't feel uncomfortable walking around alone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: tishsan
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, we enjoyed staying there rooms are clean and well kept, continental breakfast on top of the building, buetiful view, great staff very friendly, near the mall, near everything. I highly recommend this hotel we had such a great view and a great time. A++++ service.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At $169 a night, this hotel is VERY overpriced. It has a phenomenal location, and the street noise was not bad, but the property feels shabby. This hotel has none of the luxuries that a hotel in this price range should have. The front desk was not only messy, but the service was not professional. The elevators were dirty, and my room's carpet was old and very worn. The towels in the bathroom didn't match. The room's wet bar, fridge and microwave looked like something from a college dorm room. There also was no high-speed internet available in the rooms, which a hotel of this price range should offer. After one night, I checked out and moved to the Sheraton Suites up the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Up On A Roof”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon in September, 2004. Having stayed in Best Western hotels up to this point, it was a real joy to find the GPS had maintained the original design. The long corridors were reminiscent of the hotel in The Shining (!) and the glass doors to the rooms added an elegance to the decor. We were staying in one of the cheapest suites and although it was clean, had everything we needed and was well kept, it was a touch small. That didn't matter though as you're only there to sleep. Having breakfast on the roof was a real treat and we would also sit on the roof at night and watch the lights and sounds of San Diego with a drink in hand - we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable room; in the heart of one of SD's best districts.”
Reviews.Author: lucamoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gaslamp Plaza the last 5 days of August 2004 on a vacation to San Diego. We had an experience which definitely surpassed our expectations. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable. Staff were rather informal, calling us by our first names, but were hospitable, knowledgeable of their city, and genuinely nice. But the best feature of this quality hotel is its LOCATION. We had some friends who met us in SD and they stayed in the Grand Manchester Hyatt. While they had a beautiful hotel and all the amenities, they couldn't believe we had such a good room ourselves, at a lower price, and in the middle of everything cool about downtown SD. Caution: if you're looking for a hotel for kids or elderly folks, this isn't a good choice. But if you like good clubs, music venues, great restaurants and real nightlife, I recommend Gaslamp Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay mid-week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Clean, comfortable room. Close to everything! Horton Plaze is 1.5 blocks. Bus and trolley lines 1 block. The trolley takes you all around town and even right to the Mexican border. Walk or short bus ride to the Santa Fe station to take the Coaster up to Oceanside. You can walk or bus to Seaport Village or to the harbor for bay cruises or the ferry to Coronado. Easy bus ride to the zoo and museums in Balboa part. The Gaslamp Quarter has an amazing number of restaurants and clubs. You get the street noise you'd expect at any urban hotel (less than we experienced in San Francisco, though) but that included a street guitarist playing relaxing music across the street. I plan to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “No Window!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Could not believe that we were given a room for 5 day visit with NO WINDOW! Had made reservations in advance and were told that the room would be small, but had not been told that there would be no window! Noisy with band playing on Saturday night but quiet enough on remaining nights of stay. Clean room, courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment + Street Noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was expecting better based on the reviews. #1 complaint was street noise -- specifically, a nearby street singer with amp till 1 AM on a Wednesday nite. Complained to desk & was informed that San Diego has no municipal noise ordinance so calling the police would do nothing. Also, bed was small, coke machine in basement broken, crappy breakfast, roof under repair. Heard another woman complain that she was given a room near the elevator which was very noisey. In room kitchenette was nice as was convenience to the Gaslamp & Balboa park.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, but very noisy on weekends!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool, interesting Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only problem (and it was a big one) is that the Gaslamp Plaza Suites is located right smack in the middle of most of the clubs in the gaslamp district. We stayed here on a Saturday night and the noise from the street kept us up until about 2:30 AM. This was pounding music from the clubs and cars, as well as the sounds of people out on the street. It may be better on weeknights or on higher floors (we were on the 4th floor.) After this, I wouldn't stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Gaslamp Plaza Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 520 E St., San Diego, CA 92101
